medical_history.chief_complaint: Planned repeat cesarean section due to placenta previa.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was admitted for scheduled cesarean delivery at 36 weeks 4 days of gestation after experiencing vaginal bleeding at 33 weeks of gestation. The bleeding was bright red and occurred while she was awake, along with occasional contractions. She reported no recent trauma or sexual intercourse. Upon examination, she had a large volume of bright red blood, with three large clots.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of sciatica for which she underwent lumbar laminectomy. Previous cesarean section due to breech presentation.
medical_history.social_history: Monogamous with her husband, who has HIV-1. No smoking, alcohol consumption, or illicit drug use.
